DIV1.HEAD: Die Evangelien-Geschichten der Homiliensammlung des Ms. Vernon, ausgezogen von Dr. Carl Horstmann.

DIV2.HEAD: 1) De conuersione marie Magdalene. Die Evangelien, wozu die ein∣zelnen Legenden gehören, s. in mei∣nen Altengl. Legenden p. XXVII, Anm. Ms. Vernon folgt in den ersten Legenden, bis Nr. 12, gerade der al∣testenerhaltenen Hs. dieser ursprüng∣lich im nördlichen Dialekte abgefass∣ten Homiliensammlung, dem v. Small edirten Ms. Edinb. (Small "English Metr. Homilies", Edinb. 1862). welches leider nur bis zu Mariä Reinigung reicht (Nr. 12); auch Nr. 4 findet sich dort nicht. Ms. Harl. 4196 und das mit diesem wörtlich übereinstimmende Ms. Cotton. Tib E VII weichen bedeutend von dieser ältesten Version ab, in der Zahl und Folge der Evangelien und Legenden, wie auch im Text, der nehr eine freie Bearbeitung zu nen∣nen ist; namentlich im Anfang feh∣len, bis auf Nr. 2, die gesammten im Ms. Edinb. und Ms. Vernon vorhan∣denen Legenden; dafür finden sich einige andere: Anastasia, Stephan, Johannes Evang., Thomas Canterb. (ganz ausradirt); weiter fehlen Nr. 14 (Marina), 16 (Placidas). 17, 18, 19, die 7 Miracles by godes body, und alle Legenden nach Theophilus; die bei∣den Legenden von Nr. 12 und Nr. 3 finden sich im 2. Theile des Ms. Harl. wieder; Nr. 45 (Petrus Tholonarius) steht im Harl. an ganz anderer Stelle, fol. 54 (zum Evang. Abiit Jhū trans mare Galil.).—Andere Mss. sind noch: Ms. Cambr. Dd 1, Ms Cambr. Gg V, Ms. Ashm. 42.

LG.L: Seint Luc., þe goode gospelere,
Telleþ vs . in what Manere
þat þis ilke . synful Marie
hedde forȝiuenes . and mercie.
HE seiþ: . In þat ilke toun
woned a Mon . þat hihte symoun.
þer Marie wonede . þat tyme þat scho
hedde wille . penaunce forte do.
þulke symon . was a Mesele,
But crist hedde . ȝiuen him his hele;
he hedde inouh . onne to lyue 11 Ms. oune.
And almus . to pore men . to ȝiue.
ffel auntur . þat he preyede crist
To ete wiþ him . at his beo wyst.
And crist, . þat syknesse from him cast,
he com . and eet wiþ him . as agest.
And sone . whon Marie . herde telle
þat crist wolde . to þe mete dwelle,
heo com . þer crist him self sete.
And sore heo gon . forte wepe,
And wiþ teres . heo wosch his feet
þat heo . of hire eȝen leet,
And wipte hem . wiþ hire here,
And custe hem . wiþ louelich chere,
And smired hem . wiþ smereles swete,
þat alle feled swetnesse . þat þer seete.—
heo hedde ibouȝt . Oynement
To smere hire oune . bodi gent,
To Make smellen . hire bodi,
while heo haunted . hire foly.—
þis symon, . þat i spak of are,
Bi heold þis wommon . louely fare,
And þouhte, ȝif crist . were prophete,
he ouhte witen . ho hondlede his fete,
And also he ouhte witen þat ho
weore not worþi such dedes do:
ffor sunne made hire . vnworþi
To neihȝen . þat is so holy.
And as symoun . þouhte þis,
Crist wuste . what he þouȝte, iwis,
And seide: symoun, . tak hede to me:
Ichaue sum þyng . to speke wiþ þe.
symoun onswerde . and seide hym tille:
sey on, Mayster, . what is þi wille.
Crist set him . ensaumple þon
And seide: . hit was ariche mon,
þis riche mon bedde . dettours fele: 47 Ms. douhtres.
summe weore false . and summe weore lele:
A Mon ouhte him . fifty penys,
A noþur . an hundred . or þe pris.
Nouþer of hem nedde . a peny to ȝelde.
And he kudde corteysliche . and belde 52 Small: curtaysi.
And forȝaf hem . heore dette boþe
wiþ oute stresse . wiþ oute loþe.
wheþer of þeos two . louede him mare? 55 Ms. he.
symon onswerde . crist ful raþe
And seide he . þat he most for ȝaue 57 him.
wiþ rihte more loue schulde . to him haue.
Crist seide: þou hast . demed riht,
ffor þus fareþ dette . of synful wiht.
I com hider in . a couþ (!) mon,
watur to my feet . þou beode me non,
And þis wommon . haþ wassche my feet
wiþ þe teres . þat heo leet,
And hire hed . haþ heo made bare 65 Ms. þat st. haþ.
And wipe(d) my feet . wiþ hire hare;
þou cust me nout, . siþe i com in:
To Cusse my feet . heo ne con blyn;
þerfore . for ȝiuen is hire syn,
ffor muche loue . þat heo kudde heer in:
þe lasse . þat mon loueþ me,
þe lasse synne . for ȝiue mai be,
Bote, for hire loue is . to me so lele,
I. for ȝiue . hire synnes fele.
Go, he seide, . wommon, in pees,
ffor alle þi synnes . for ȝiuen is.
þis tale . haue i told ow,
To schewen ow . what maner and hou
þat, whon crist comeþ . in to vre hertes,
To leue vr synnes . he us ertes,
And make us aske him . forȝiuenesse
Of alle vr synnes . more and lesse.

DIV2.HEAD: 2) Monachus quidam post mor∣tem reuelat socio suo statum suum.

LG.L: A blac Monk . In an Abbay
was ffermer, as I. herde say;
he was holden . an holy mon
A Mong his felawes euerichon.
A Cloyster Monk . louede hym wel
And was to him ful speciel—
ffor comuynliche . to gedere drawes
Trust . and trewe . and goode felawes.
ffel aunter . þat þis ilke ffermere
was seek. . and he þat was him dere
Com to make him . glad and bliþe
And his loue . to him (to) kiþe.
he asked him . hou he ferde . and felede.
And he his stat . to him telde,
And seide: . ful harde fele I. me,
To deþ i drawe, . as þou miht se.
his felawe was . for him sori,
And preyed hym . ful ȝeorne forþi:
ȝif god dude . of him his wille,
he schulde schewe . his stat him tille.
þis seke mon hiȝte . to come him to,
ȝif he mihte gete . leue þer to.
I. schal, he seide, . ȝif I. may,
Cum to þe, . my stat to say.
whon þis was seid, . he diȝede sone.
And his felawe . asked his bone
And preied god . for his merci
þat he schulde schewe him . openli,
Oþur slepynge . or wakynge,
Of his felawes stat . sum tiþinge.
And as he lay . on a niht,
his felawe com . wiþ lemes liht
And tolde him boþe . of heuene . and helle.
And he preyed . he schulde him telle
his stat . and he seide: wel fare I
þorwh þe help . of vre ladi;
Neore heo, . I. hedde beo gon,
To wone in helle . wiþ sathan.
his felawe þhouȝte . her of ferly,
And asked him . wherfore and whi,
And seide: . we wende þat þow
hedde beo euere holy . til now;
hou schal hit fare . of vs caytyues
þat in synne . and folye lyues,
whon þou þat laddest . so holy lyf
were dampned . to helle . forte drif?
whon he hed seid, . þe dede onswerd
And tolde his felawe . hou he ferd,
And seide anon: . whon I. ȝaf þe gast,
To my dom . was I. lad . in hast;
And as i stod, . my dom to here,
Bi fore Ihc̄ . wiþ dreri chere,
Of fendes hedde I. mony vbbreide;
And a Bok was . bi fore me leyde,
þat was þe Rule . of seint Benete
þat I. hihte . to holde and gete.
þe rule þei made . me to rede.
And as I. radde, . sore gon i drede;
Ouer lepe . mihti make non,
Bote of þe clauses . euerichon
harde a countes . I. gan ȝelde,
And my concience . gon (me) melde:
hit schewed þere . ful openliche
þat I. ladde my lyf . wrongwysliche:
ffor in þe Rule . is mony a paas
þat aȝeyn me . I. cast was;
wherfore ich hedde . almest riht þare
Beo demed to helle . forte fare.
Bote, for I. louede wel . vr ladi
while i liuede, . I. hedde forþi
Good help þere . þorwh hire merci,
ffor heo bi souhte crist . inwardly
þat I. mihte . in purgatori
Clause my sunne . and my foli.
þerfore I. hope . to fare ful wel,
ffor my serwe . schal sone akel.
þerfore, my frend . I. preye þe
þou make my felawes . preye for me.
whon þis was seid, . awey he wente.
And his felawe . ful muchel him mente,
And afturward . mony a day
Made he for his soule pray.
þis tale . haue I told ow
To schewe . in what maner and hou
we schul be demed . and ȝelde a counte
what vr synne . may a mounte,
ffor al schal come . to rounge i wis
þer þat heere . mis taken is, 88 Ms. þei st. þer.
Beo þe leste . idel þouht,
ffor þer for ȝiuen . is riht nouht.

DIV2.HEAD: 3) Tod des Johannes. Diese Erzählung "in stude of tale".)

LG.L: þe kyng heroude . wiþ muchel miht
Refte his broþur wyf, . þat hiht
herodyas. . and seint Jon herde
wiþ what kines synne . heroud ferde,
And snibbed him foule . of his synne,
And bad him . þat he schulde blynne.
wherfore heroude . as feloun
Dude seint Jon . in his prisoun.
herodias, . þat wikked wommon,
wolde ful fayn þat Jon weore slon:
he greued . hire fleschlich lykyng.
þerfore heo wolde . to deþe him bring.
Enchesun to hym . fond heo nan,
ffor heroudes, . þat hedde him tan,
Sayh þat he was . an holy man,
And þhouȝte loþ . to ben his ban—
ffor of seint Jon . stod him awe,
And sunged þe lasse . for his sawe,
And herde his wordes . wiþ good wille,
And dude muche . þat he seide him tille.
heroudes made a feste . and calde
Princes þer to . and bernes balde.
And as he . wiþ his gestes sete
And mad him glad . and dronk and ete,
Bi fore him com . a ȝong laas,
þat herodias . douhter was,
And Toumbede . so wel wiþ alle:
Alle þat weren gedered . in þat halle
Alle weren a payed . wiþ hire play.
And heroudes . to hire gon say:
what so þou wolt, . aske me,
fful bleþeliche . wol I. graunte þe.
he swor his oth . he wolde folfille
Al hir askyng . and hire wille:
þeih þou, he seide, . aske haluendel
Mi kinedom, . I. graunte hit wel.
þis Mayde ron . to hire modur swiþe
And bad hire . þat heo scholde liþe
what þe kyng . hire hedde i bede.
Modur, heo seide, what to rede? 40 Small: and askid hir moder quat scho rede.
hire modur was fayn, . whon heo þis herde,
And sone hire douhtur . heo onswerde
And seide: . loke þou aske nouht
But þat seint Jones hed . beo brouht
In a disch sone . bi fore þe.
þis Mayden ron . to þe kyng,
And seide: sire, . þis is myn askyng—
ȝif þou wolt . my wille beo done,
Graunte me . myn askyng sone:
ȝif me in a disch . I. weued
Seint Jon, . þe Baptist, heued.
Vuel a payed . was þe kyng,
whon he herde . hire askyng.
him þhouȝte schome . aȝein to calle
þat he hedde hiht . bi foren hem alle,
And for he hedde . i sworen his oth,
To wraþþe þe Mayde . him was loth.
þerfore he sente . his quellere son
And bad . hire wille . schulde beo don.
his quellere dude . as he him bad
And made þis Mayde child . ful glad:
ffor he brouht hire, . as he hedde iseid,
seint Jones hed . in a disch ileyd.
þus was þis Mayde . seint Jones ban,
þat was for riht . and soþsawe slayn.
Bote for him . hed he nouht . tynt his hede.
ȝif he wolde haue weued as a Reode,
ȝif he nedde nout . snibbed þe kyng,
But loued his dedes . in alle þing,
þen miht he han gon . quit a way
And liued . in worldes wele . and play.
But he dude . bettre i wis:
ffor nou is he . in wel more blis,
And heroudes . and herodias
Beon in helle . wiþ sathanas.
Now ȝe han herd . hou seint Jon stod
ffor sothfastnesse . and schedde his blod.
þerfore . in vr gospel . seiþ crist
To þe folk of s. Jon þe Baptist:
wende ȝe . of s. Jon . to fynde
A Reod . þat weueþ wiþ þe wynde?
Nay, . But so studefast is he
þat noþing makeþ him twifold be.
ffor he schal stonde . in studefastnes
And þole deþ . for rihtwysnes. ...

DIV2.HEAD: 4) De milite depauperato dili∣gente matrem domini.

LG.L: HIt was a kniht . bi ȝonde þe séé
þat riche mon . was wont to be
And vche ȝeer . was wont to make
A ffeste . for vre ladies sake.
But he spendet . so largely,
þat in pouert . he fel in hih.
A. good wommon . he hedde to wyue.
þat louede vr ladi . al hire lyue.
þe fend was . to hire ful kene—
þat was aftur . ful wel i sene.
ffor, whon tyme com . he schulde make
A. ffeste, . and hedde nouȝt . to take,
Durste he nouht . dwelle at home,
But wente in to desert . for schome
And dwellede þere . him al one,
Til þe tyme of feste . was gone.
þus dude þe kniht . mony a ȝere
And made mournyng . and vuel chere.
þe ffend sauh . he was sori,
And wolde do skaþe . to his ladi,
But mihte he neuere . come hire nere
ffor holy lyf . and goode preyere.
Bote to hire lord . in wildernesse
he com . in monnes liknesse
And asked him whi . he weore sori.
And he tolde him . þe resun whi.
I. was, he seide, . a Riche mon,
And my Catel . is from me gon;
And a feste . I. was wond to make,
And nou haue I. nouht to take:
þerfore þar þe . þenke . no ferly
þei I. heo careful . and sori.
þe ffend onswerde . and seide him to:
ȝif þow wolt . my wille do,
I. schal þe make . wel bettre fare
þen bi fore dude þou . euer are,
Richesse plente . I. schal þe ȝiue,
wher of þou mayht . ful murie liue.
þe kniht hihte . to don his wille.
And he onswerde . and seide him tille:
Go swiþe . and graue vp þe gold
þat þere lyth . vndur þe Mold,
And aftur cum . and spek wiþ me;
And loke þou bringe þi wyf wiþ þe,
þat day schaltou bringe hire þe wiþ,
ffor wiþ ow boþe . wol I. me kiþ.
þe kniht wust not . hit was þe fende,
But tok leue . and hom gon wende,
And com and fond . þer gold leyd
þer þe deuel hedde him seid.
þis kniht was fayn . of his fynding
And þouhte folfulle . his hihtyng
þat he hihte . to þe fende:
Elles he þouhte . him self vnhende,
ȝif he ne heold . þat he him bad
þorwh whom . so muchel murþe he had.
More þen he was . wont to do
Made he feste . and calde men þerto.
whon tyme com . þat þe fend hedde set
To come to him . þer he him met,
he bad his wyf scholde . wiþ him wende—
ffor so hadde he hiht . to þe fende.
his wyf was for him . selly rad
And ordeynde hire . as he hire bad.
On heore palfreys . rod þei baþe. 65 Ms. bare.
And bi a Chapel . eode þei raþe.
þis ladi . to hire lord spake
And seide: sire, . I. rede we make
In þis Chapel . vre preyere,
þat god vs kepe . boþe hol and fere.
þis kniht was ful . of Jolyte,
And of preyere . no fors made he,
And seide: . wel mote þou lihte and prey,
ffor I. wol fare forþ . in my wei;
And ȝif þou dwelle longe, . i wol beo wroþ.
A. sire, seide heo, . þat were me loþ.
þis ladi a lihte . not forþi
And made hire preyere inwardli.
And fel on sleepe . in hire preyere.
But heer may ȝe . gret ferly here:
ffor vr ladi . þer heo lay
Com forþ, . and steih . on hire palfray,
In hire liknes, . and forþ heo rod
Riht to þis kniht . þat hire a bod.
þis kniht wende witerli . heo ware
his wyf, . and forþ gunne þei fare.
whon þei come þere . þe steuene was set,
wiþ sathanas . þei boþe met.
whon sathanas . sayh vr ladi,
he kneouh hire wel, . and made a cri
vppon þis kniht . and seide soone:
Allas traytur, . what hast þou done?
I. bad þe bringe . þi wyf to me,
And cristes modur . her i se!
honged beo þou . bi þe hals,
ffor ffikel mon art þou . and fals.
who was a bascht . but þis kniht!
And of his palfrey . gon he liht,
And fel doun . to vr ladi feete
And asked hire Merci, . and sore gon wepe.
heo chidde him . as kniht vn hende
þat made such forward . wiþ þe fende,
And bad he scholde . waxe wys
And beo bisy . in hire seruys.
heo seide: . do a wey . þe fendes ȝifte,
And god schal wel . þi catel lyfte.
whon þis was seid, . heo wente a wey.
And þis kniht leop . on his palfrey,
And rod to þe Chapel, . and fond
his wyf . bi fore þe a(u)ter . slepond,
And þonked Marie . inwardly
þat saued him . and his ladi
Be þis tale . may we seon alle
þat alle þat wolen . on Marie calle
heo helpeþ hem . in alle nede
And schildeþ hem . from wikked hede.
Preye we þerfore . þat heo vs spede,
vr lyf in penaunce . þat we lede,
And at vre endynge . heo vs lede
To heuene blisse, . to take vre mede.
AMEN . I. rede . alle we synge,
ffor of þat blisse . is non endynge.

DIV2.HEAD: 5) Quidam pergens ad scm Ja∣cobum abscidit verenda sua.

LG.L: (But for i seide . þat sathanas
wayted vs . as þef in paas,
I. wol ou telle . of a pilgrym
how Sathanas . bi gyled him.) 1-4 sind die letzten Verse der der Erzäblung vorangehenden Erklärung des Evangeliums.
HIt was a Mon, . as I. herde say,
þat to seint James . hiȝt his way.
And þat day . þat he schulde wende
he made a feste . to al his frende.
ffel auenture . þat he was so glad.
þat sathanas made . him ful maad
And made him sungun . dedly
wiþ a wommon . in lecheri.
Whon he hedde . his sunne don,
On his wey he wente him son.
And he þat made him . falle in blame
Mette him in liknes . of seint Jame
And asked himwhodur . he wolde wende.
But he wust not . hit was þe fende.
he seide: . I. make my viage
To seynt Jemes . In pilgrimage.
þe fend onswerde . and asked son:
wostou not what . þou hast i don
In Lecherie . aȝeynes me?
I. am seint Jame . þat speke wiþ þe;
þou art vn worþi . me to seke,
þi viage . is not worþ a leke;
wenest þou . þi synne . from me hyde?
whon þou hit dust, . I. was bi syde;
þi viage may not . paye me,
But ȝif þou do þat . I. bidde þe.
þis mon wende . þat he seint Jem were,
And seide: . lord, ich am al redi here
Euere to beo . boxum þe to
And don . al þat ȝe bidde me do.
Go swiþe, he seide, . and gelde þe,
þat I. þi repentaunce . may se,
And kut þi þrote a two . riht sone,
ffor þenne hastou . my wille I. done,
whon þou hast . þi self i slon,
To heuene . wol I. make þe gon.
þe pilgrym wende . to paye seint Jame
And dude him self . muche schame,
ffor he cutte . a wey ful raþe
his Membres . and his pendauns baþe,
And seþþe he cutte a two . his þrote:
so he dude him . luyte note.
þo was sathanas . ful redi
And tok þe soule . gredily,
And made gret Joye . of his pray,
And touward helle . he tok þe way.
Seint peter . and seint Jem . him mette,
And boþe heo gunnen . his wey to lette.
seint Jem seide . to þe fende:
whodur woltou . wiþ my pilgrym wende?
he onswerde . and seide: to helle,
þer he schal . for his seruyse . dwelle;
ffor he was . his oune bone,
þerfore of hym . part hastou none,
wiþ riht . and resun . he is myn,
To wende wiþ me . to helle pyn.
seint Jame onswerde . for his man
And seide: þou lyȝest, . traitur sathan!
þou wost wel, þef, . þou hast þe wouh,
ffor my Mon . him self not slouh: 64 Sm: for in mi nam himself he sloh.
he wende wel . þou heddest ben I.,
whon þou madest him . do þis foli;
he was in dede . to me boxume;
þerfore schal he . wiþ me come.
þe fend seide: . þat may not be,
wiþ riht and lawe . may þow se
þat he is myn . þorwh Jugement:
ffor, whon he . on his vyage went,
he fuylede his soule . dedlye
wiþ þe sunne . of lecherye,
siþen . wiþ his owne knyf
he refte him self . his owne lyf;
sei me, Jame, . on what kyn wyse
Mai he more dye . In my seruyse?
Loke ȝif I. wiþ rihte . or lawe
Mai him wiþ me . to helle drawe.
seint Jame onswerde and seide him to:
wrong ne wol I non do;
Bote ȝif we wolle . þe soþe trye,
Go we to dom . of vre ladye,
And as heo demeþ . hit schal be,
ffor þat is riht, . as þynkeþ me.
And seint peter, . his felawe,
seide: . þis is riht . good lawe;
Marie, he seide, . is gode Justise,
heo wol don riht . on alle wyse.
whon þei come bi fore . vr ladi,
heo demede sone . þorwh hire Merci
þat þe soule . to þe bodi
schulde tornen . and don penaunce worþi,
And seide: þis soule . as hit nou is
May not come . to heuene blis,
Ar hit beo clansed . in bodi
Of synne . wiþ penaunce worþi;
þerfore . þis Juggement ȝiue I
þat hit torne . to þe bodi
And clanse hit wiþ schrifte . and penaunce
And kepe hit seþþen . from mis chaunce.
þe ffend . for þis dom . was sori
And vuel payed . þat vre ladi
hedde i reft him . wiþ riht Jugge∣ment
þat mon wyþ gyle . þat he hedde Ischent.
whon þis soule . was comen a ȝeyn
To þe bodi, . hit was so fayn. 108 Sm.: this man was fain.
A Monk in Denyn (!) . he him ȝold, 109 Sm. Cluny.
And þis tale . to his Abbot told
hou he was schent . bi gylerie
And I. saued . bi vre ladi.
Gerant he hihte, . and fro þat tym 113 Sm. Georard.
þat he to crist hedde . I. ȝolden hym
holy mon he was . and good
And seruede god . wiþ miht and mood.
But þer his þrote . was kut wiþ knyf
A Red Marke was . al his lyf,
And þere his Membres . were by fore
hedde he not aftur . but a bore.
Beo þis tale . may we seo
þat wys . and war . bi houeþ vs beo
þat sathanas . ne make vs rayke
ffrom rihtwysnes . to synful layke,
ffor, ȝif he fynde vs . out of strete,
he byndeþ vs boþe . hond and fete,
þat is to sigge: . ȝif he vs fynde
In dedly synne, . he may vs bynde
wiþ wikked wille . and make vs wende
ffrom synne to synne, . and so vs schende:
ffor, as he made . þis pilgrym go
ffrom synne to synne, . him self to slo,
so makeþ he mon . go gostly
ffrom Couetyse . to Glotony,
ffrom Glotony . to Lecherye,
And so to Pruyde . an(d) to Envye,
And atte laste . in his prisoun
he doþ him self . þef . and ffeloun.

DIV3.HEAD: a. how þe deuel apperede to seynt Martyn.

LG.L: (ffor noþing is, . as I. seide are,
þat woundeþ sathanas so sare
As doþ þe tokne . of Meknes,
ffor aȝein fendes . mest hit is.).
þat may ȝe . be seint Martin se.
ffor in his lyf . fynde we
þat, as he was . in Orisoune,
þen com þe fend . as kyng wt Croune,
Cloþed in palle . and riche wede,
And seide: Martin, . I. wol þe lede
To heuene, . þat is þi longe rest;
ffor wite þou wel . þat I. am crist:
þat maiht þou . beo my feirnes se;
þerfore i wole . þat þou loute to me.
And Martyn . þorwh grace wyst
þat he was not . Jhū crist,
And seide to hym . wiþ mylde chere:
I. wol not seo . my lord here,
But in þat blisse . þer he euer is.
And for þis .o. word . of Mekenis
þe fend wente away . as reke
And fleih him . for his onswere meke.

DIV3.HEAD: b. þat meknesse eschapet þe deueles wyles.

LG.L: And of seint Antoyne . fynde we
þat so Meke . and . Mylde . was he
þat þorw . Mekenes . mony a tym
he fledde fendes . from hym.
And on a tyme . as he stod,
he sauh . al þe eorþe was sprad
wiþ panters . and wiþ grones (!) blake, 29 Sm.: gylders st. grones (groues?).
þat sathanas . hedde I. leyd . to take
ffor Monnes soule, . as a foulere 31 for zu tilgen.
Takeþ foules . wiþ his pantere.
þen seyde Antony, . þi gode hermyte:
Lord, what þing . schal passe quite
And in þeos snarles . not beo tan?
And God onswerde: . Mekenesse alon.

DIV3.HEAD: c. þat amon tryste holly in god.

LG.L: A noþur hermyte . hette Makarie,
To whom þe fend hedde . gret Envye.
And on a day . þe fend him mette.
fful fayn he wolde . his weyes lette,
And seide: þou dost . me gret dispyte,
ffor wiþ no synne mai I. þe smyte,
And al þe penaunce . not forþi
þat I. seo þe do, . al do I.:
þou fastes muche, . and I. faste ay,
ffor I. ete nouþur . Niht . ne day,
þow wakest muche, . and so I. do,
ffor I. haue nouþur . Reste ne Ro;
Bote wiþ .o. þing . þou passest me,
so þat I. may not . do to þe.
what is þat? . quaþ Makari.
Of þi Mekenes, . he seide, speke I.,
ffor wiþ Mekenes . þou passest me;
þat schendeþ me, . whon I. hit se.
ffor so Meke . was Makarye
þat of his Mekenes . was ferlye.
In hermitage . longe woned he,
In ffelde, . by syde . a gret Citéé:
Out of þat Citéé . was he fledde,
And as an hermite . such lyf he ledde
þat his Mekenes . and his gode lyf
was sone . to al þe Cuntre ryf.
Anoþur hermyte . com him tille
And serued him . al at his wille.
ffel auntur . þat þis Makarye
Com to þe Citéé . riuelye,
To sulle þere . his hondewerk.
And so fel auntur . þat a Clerk
spac wiþ a Burgeys douhter so,
þat synful pley . þei pleyed þo.
whon child in wombe . schaped was,
ffadur . and . Modur asked þis laas
who hedde i don . wiþ hire folye.
heo seide: þe hermyte Makarie.
fful wroþ weore alle . hire frendes þan
wiþ Makarie, . þat holy man.
þei token him . and duden him schame,
As he hedde spilt . þat wommones fame:
A boute þe Market . þev hym ledde
And beoten him . þat his bodi bledde,
And made him fynde . borwes þan
To ffede . and . Cloþe . þis womman.
þe toþur hermyte, . þat serued him,
was bi syde . þat ilke tym, 84 Ms. bi seyd st. bi syde.
And þhouȝte gret schome . of (t)his chaunce,
And wepte for his Mayster . penaunce.
Makari preyed him . þat he
schulde in þat cas . his borwh be.
And he bi com . his Borwh þare,
ffor him was wo . for his mis fare.
To him self . seide Makari:
A. wyf haue I. now, and forþi
Bi houeþ me worche fastore and Mare,
Boþe niht . and . day, . þen I. dude are:
Elles may I. not . wiþ my dede
Mi seluen . and my lemmon fede.
Niht . and . day . wrouhte . Makari
And sente þis wommon . aparti
þat he wiþ his werk . mihte gete.
And þerwiþ . heo bouht hire mete.
þis wommon eode . wiþ childe . ful longe
And þolede pyne . wondur stronge:
heo miht haue non . diliueraunce,
Er heo hedde told . þorwh what chaunce
heo hedde Conceyued, . and of wham,
And quite seint Makarie . of Blam.
whon hire frendes . herden þis,
heo seȝen wel . heo hedden do mis,
whon þei beoten . seint Makari.
þerfore þei wolde . crie him Merci.
And seint Makari . herde sey
þat þei wolde come: . he fleyh a wey,
ffor he dredde . to leose Mekenes
wiþ loue word . and derworþnes—
ffor loue word . and worldes blis
Makeþ Mon leose . Mekenes i wis.
þerfore crist fleyh . Monnes louyng,
whon þe Jewes . wolde make him kyng:
ffor worldus serwe . and pouert
holdeþ Mekenes . in Monnes hert,
And worldus welþe . makeþ mon ful mad.
And þerfore . Makarie hit fled.
þeos þreo tales . I. haue ow tolde,
To make ow . in oure herte holde
þat euere þe holyore . þat mon is
þe more loue he . Mekenes.

DIV2.HEAD: 7) how a bisschop bylay a nonne.

LG.L: AN Erchebisschop . bi ȝonde þe séé
was wonynge . in a riche Citéé.
An holi mon . and good . he was;
But ffurst he fel, . and siþen he ras,
ffor þe fend hedde . to him Envye
And made him falle . in Lecherye,
In a wondur . foul Manere,
As ȝe may . bi þis tale here.
A Nonneri was . in þat Contre,
ffyue Mile . fro þis Bisschop Cite.
And in þis ilke forseid . Nonnerie
Dwelled Nonnes . wondur Monye,
þat serued god . and vre lady
And heold hem wel . from vileny.
Aunter fel . þat to þat house
Come Maydenes, . Ihū crist to spouse:
þeos Maydenes were sent . veil to take
Of þat Bisschop . of whom i spake.
þis Bisschop, . as þe Maner was,
Reuested him . to singe his Mas.
þeos Maydens come . bi fore þe autere
And tok heore veil . in feir Manere.
And þis Bisschop . his eȝe vp kest
To on of hem, . þat was feirest:
his loue was sone . on hire ikest,
so harde, . þat he . mihte haue . no rest,
ffor sathanas dude . his Maistri
And tempted him . wiþ lecheri.
To þis Mayde . he caste his eȝe,
And him þhouȝte . he scholde dye
But he hedde . of hire his wille,
þat mihte wiþ hire . his lust folfille.
her mowe ȝe seo . on what seruyse
þe ffend serueþ . wiþ his queyntyse,
ffor ȝerne he lokeþ . on what wyse
he may make vs leose . paradyse,
him þinkeþ ful loþ . Men come þer Inne,
þerfore he makeþ vs . falle in synne.
þeos Maydens, . whon þei halewed ware,
þei toke heore leue, . hom to fare,
þei wente hom . to heore Nonneri.
But þis Bisschop lefte . ful sori.
he was fondet . inwardly
wiþ brennynde lust . of lecheri,
ffor he mihte nouþur . ete ne drinke,
Ne a nihtes . slepe . ne wynke; 46 Small: Ne haue night rest, ne slepe no wynk.
ffor loue him þhouȝte . his herte barst.
And he by þouhte him . atte last
hou he mihte . þis Mayde fonge,
To slake his lust . þat was so stronge.
Lettres he sente . hastifly
To þe Abbesse . of þe Nonnery
And bad heo schulde come . a non him to,
þe neodes . of hire hous . to do.
whon þe Abbesse . þis tiþing herde,
To þe Bisschop . sone heo ferde.
As sone as heo was . come þare,
þe Bisschop schewed hire . his care.
so muche serwe, he seide, . I. drye,
þat for loue . almost i. dye;
Bote þou helpe me . of þis cas,
Of me þou leosest . help and gras;
I haue I. holden þin hous in riht
And holpen þe . wiþ al my miht:
Nou þou miht . my trauayl ȝelde,
ȝif þou wolt . to my longyng helde;
I preye þe . þou graunte me . my wille
And make þat Nonne . come me tille
þat I. halewede heere . þe ȝondurday, 69 Sm. ȝistirdaye.
ffor al gate wiþ hire . wol I. play;
Elles, forsoþe . I. þe say,
I. dye . ar come . þe þridde day;
To do þe good . I. haue I. mynt,
And ȝif I dye, . þou hast hit tynt;
And ȝif þou helpe me . in þis nede,
wel i schal quite . þe þi mede,
ffor nou I. may . seo and fynde
ȝif þou to me . beo ouht kynde;
Blyue graunte me . my bone
And make þat Nonne . cum to me sone.
A non he nempned . þe Nonnes nome,
he nolde lette . for no schome.
whon þis Abbes . þis wordus herd,
heo was wondred . and a ferd,
ffor heo wende neuere . such wordus to here
þt þis Bisschop wolde speke . of such Matere.
heo stod . and bi þouht hire þo
what god þis Bisschop . hedde hire do,
ffor hire hous . and hire couent:
ffor boþe he hedde . hem ȝiuen and lent;
heo bi þouhte hire . furþurmore
þat þorwh him was heo . Abbes þore.
þerfore þhouȝte . hire ful loþ
ffor eny þing . to make him wroþ:
þerfore heo graunted . him his bone
And wente hom . to hir Nonneri sone.
þe Nonne . ful priuely . heo calde
And tolde hire . what þe Bisschop wolde,
And seide: . but heo dude . his wille,
þat Nonnerie . wolde he spille.
þis ȝonge Mayde . was vn mihti
To stonde aȝeyn . þis foly,
And seide anon: . my ladi,
To don his wille . ich am redi.
þe Mayde wente . to þe Bisschop þore
And Made . of hir self . an hore.
Allas Allas . heo nedde i wist
what forward . heo made wiþ crist!
fforsoþe, . ȝif heo hedde . I. sene
hou feir heo was . and hou clene
whil þat heo was . Mayden schene,
hedde heo not sunged, . as I. wene.
Allas þat heo ne vndurstood
hou crist (þat) hire bouhte . on þe Rood 114 Ms. fehlt þat,
had taken hire . as his lele spouse 115 and st. had; so Sm.
And brouht hire . to his owne house!
Me þinkeþ heo chaunged . wrecchedly,
whon heo lafte crist, . hire lotebi,
And tok hire . to a synful Mon,
To bi come . his lemmon.
A. lord, . sereweful . hedde heo ben,
ȝif heo . hire owne stat . hedde sen:
hou feir heo was . gostly and briht
whil hire Maydenhod . was hiht; 124 Small: was hir tight.
Loþ hedde hire ben . don þat synne,
ffor Gold . or . seluer . or worldus wynne!
But for heo was . as wommon wayk,
heo sentede sone . to synful layk,
þat Made hire bi fore god . ful loþe,
In bodi . and in soule boþe:
ffor þer heo lees . hir Maidenhede,
And þer wiþ al . hire blisful mede
þat Maydens schulde haue . in þat blis,
þat crist, heore lemmon, . schal hem kis. 134 Small: thare st. þat.
And alle þat wole . þis tale here,
Good ensaumple . þei mowe lere
vn siker . of hem self . to beo,
ȝif þei wole vndurstonde . and seo
hou wys mon . þe Bisschop was,
And hou foule . he fel in plas:
so stifliche . aȝeyn him ras
þe fend . þat him felde in plas.
vuele we ouhte . lauhwe . and kenne, 143 Sm. kinc st. kenne.
who(n) we on þis Bisschop þenke:
ffor þat þef . þat Made him falle
Is faste a boute . to slee vs alle.
But mon makeþ hym . ofte schurne
And casteþ him wiþ his owne torne,
whon þat he . him schriueþ of synne
And kepeþ no more . falle þer Inne.
A. lord, . muchel is þi Merci,
ffor euer, lord, . þou art redi
To forȝiue vs . vre folye,
As ofte as we . merci crye!
Beo vr synne . neuer so vily,
þou for ȝiuest hit vs . frely,
þat alle men may . þenke ferly
Of þi pite . and þy mercy.
þar no mon falle . in wonhope
þat þenkeþ wel . on þis Bisschope:
ffor þis Bisschop, . of whom I. telle,
so deope in fulþe . of synne felle,
þat he was worþi . beo brend in helle,
Euer more . þer Inne to dwelle—
ȝif hit nedde beo . þorwh þi mercj
þat made him rise . of synne in heih.
þerfore schulde alle men . loue þe
And boxum . to þi wille be.
ffor þou þat Makest . þe doumbe speke,
þorwh schrift . þou madest þe Bis∣schop breke
þe ffendes bond . and his Maystri.
we ouhte wel blesse þe . derworþly!
kepe I. no lengore heere dwelle,
But forþ i wole . vr tale telle,
hou þe Bisschop . wiþ penaunce ras
Out of his synne . wiþ godus gras.
whon þis Bisschop . þis synne hedde don,
vr lord sende . him grace son
And made him þenke wel . on his state.
And he bigon sone . for to grate,
And seide: allas . þat I. was born!
schomelich haue I. my self for lorn.
I. am a Bisschop . and schulde (wel) lyue,
Good ensaumple . to oþure ȝiue:
And I. haue so . my self I. schent,
þat I. weore worþi . to be brent.
Allas þat euere I. was a clerk!
whi tok I. on me . godus merk?
fforsoþe, I. am wel more to blame
And to þole . wel more schame
þen ben þis symple lewed menne,
ffor hem I. schulde . lere . and kenne,
And now I. am . wel worse þen þay!
I. haue I. pleyed . a careful play,
ffor I. haue broken . godus hous
And reft ichaue . Ihc̄ his spous.
Allas Allas . þat I. was born.
ffor alle men mowe . dryue me to sko(r)n.
hou schal I. fare . on domes day,
whon I. schal . beo flemed a way
ffrom godus face . in to pyne of helle,
wiþ outen ende . þer Inne to dwelle.
whon he him bi þouhte of helle pyn,
And what heo þolen . þat ben þer In,
And of þat Joye . þat he hedde tynt,
To sle him self . he hedde I. mynt.
so sereuhful . was þis Bisschope,
þat almost he fel in wonhope.
But godus grace . was sone redi
And þolede him not . to Miscari,
But cumforted him . wiþ swete fare,
And leched his serwe . and his care, 212 Small: lethed st. leched.
And maad him sone . han good hope
þat þe leste blodus drope
Of þat ilke . derworþe blode
þat Ihc̄ lette . on þe Roode
was of wel more . derworþenes
þen Alle Mennes synne . or wikkednes.
And sone he gon . calle and crye
At þe ȝates . of Mercye.
he let make him . a priue stude,
þer he mihte lyue . wiþ watur and brede.
A. pore hous . was sone purueyd,
And pore atyr . þer In was leid.
þere wonede . þe Bisschop longe
In serwe of herte . and penaunce stronge.
whon Parisschens . comen him to,
Mony neodes . wiþ him to do,
he made his seruauns . to hem say
þat he in godus bendes lay;
ffor he defendet . his seruauns
þei schulde not telle . his penauns.
þis Erchebisschop . liuide þare
In strong penaunce . and in care;
wiþ heire ful hard . his flesch he clad,
wiþ Bred . and watur he was fed.
he wrouhte þe bodi . serwe I. nouh
þat him to fulþe . and synne drouh,
he quitte hit . þat hit hedde him do
wiþ pyne . and vn reste . and vn Ro:
his foule flesch . drouh him to synne,
þerfore he made hit . pore and þunne.
þe lewed folk . weore vuel payed
And for heore Bisschop . faste þei prayed,
ffor þei wende alle . þat he sek ware;
And for him was . heore hertes sare.
Erles, . Barouns, . and knihtes,
persons, . vikeres, . and prestes
þhouȝten of heore Bisschop ferly,
And pleyned hem . and asked why
þat þei mihte not . heo(r) Bisschop se,
And wel þei wende . þat ded weore he.
summe manasede . his dore to breke,
But þei mihte . wiþ him speke.
ffayn wolde his Chaumberleyn . hem stille,
And feire . he graunted hem heore wille:
he bad hem . in þe paleys dwelle,
And seide he wolde . his lord telle
Al heore longyng . and heore wille
And make þe Bisschop . come hem tille.
þe Chaumburleyn . to chaumbre ȝode
And tolde his lord . wiþ sori moode
what þe folk . þouhte to do
Bote þei mihte . come him to.
whon þe Bisschop . herde þis,
Careful was his herte I. wis;
he chaunged sone . his sori wede
And forþ in to þe halle ȝede.
þe folk sauh wel . his pore state,
And sore for him . þei gonne grate,
ffor wel hem þhouȝte . þat he sek was:
ffor pale . and clongen . was his fas,
his skin . was clungen . to þe Bon,
ffor flesch on him . was þer non.
whon folk heore wille . hedde I. spoken,
A ȝein to Chaumbre . he was loken.
his frendes seȝe wel . bi his face
þat he hedde Mester . of solace,
And made him boþe . wel ete and drinke
And leue his outraious . swynke.
But euere . he þouhte . of þat syn
þat greued his herte . ful sore wiþ In.
And whon þe lewed folk . wel herde
þat heore bisschop . beter ferde,
þei weore fayn . and come sone
To him . and asked him abone:
þat he schulde . on an heiȝ feste day
synge hem masse, . þo preyed þay. 288 Ms. To synge; Small: gern st. þo.
þe Bisschop sone . him bi þouht
þat synge hem Masse . mihte he nouht,
Til he weore schriuen . of his synne
þat beot his herte . so sore wiþ Inne.
But not forþi . him was ful loþ
To werne hem . or to make hem wroþ.
he graunted hem. þe Masse to synge.
And heo weore fayn . of his bihotynge.
Boþe Olde . and. ȝonge, . more . and. lasse
Come forte here . þe Bisschopes masse
vppon an heih . ffeste day,
fforte heren hit . fayn weore þay.
whon þe Bisschop . to synge was graid
And riche atyr . on auter leyd,
he stood stille . and gon to preche,
As he þat couþe þe folk wel teche;
he preched . on so feir manere,
þat hit was Joye . him to here.
And whon his sarmoun . endet was,
þe folk a non . vp aras
And þonked Ihū . in þat plas
þat ȝaf þe Bisschop . such a gras.
But he Made hem sitte . adoun aȝeyn,
And seide: . ȝe ouhte . ben vn fayn
Of me . þat schulde beo . oure Bis∣schope,
ffor I. am worse . þen ȝe hope;
Ȝe wene wel nou . euerichon
þat I. beo . a ful holy mon,
And I. seye forsoþe . þat ȝe
Beo foule diseyued . on me:
ffor my self . I. haue so schent,
þat I. weore worþi . to beo brent,
ffor I. am a wrecche, . a lechour,
An vuel Mon, . and godus tratur.
Bifore him . al þe folk he cald
And to hem . al his sunne he tald.
whon he hedde seid . his sunful dede,
he caste of him . þat holy wede,
þat is to seye . his vestiment,
And þorwh þe folk . bare fot he went.
þe ffolk . bigon . to wepe . and crie
And bad him torne . a ȝeyn in hiȝe.
þei seide: . vr lord is redy
To take þe . to his Merci.
we wole, þei seide, . on vs take
Al þi synne . and al þi sake;
þerfore, ffadur, . we preye þe
Torn aȝeyn . and bisschop be.
heore preyere . miht not a uayle,
he wolde not don aftur . heore coun∣sayle,
But dude him forþ . as he weore wod,
wiþ serwe . and wiþ dreri mood,
A. wey he ron . and sore he wepte. 341 Sm. gret st. wepte.
And wiþ a wommon . sone he mette
þat bar a soukyng child . in arm,
In feire cloutus . I. wrapped warm.
þis child was not . half ȝer old,
And spac þere . wordus bold
To þe bisschop . and asked whi
he was so careful . and sori.
þe child spac þorwh þe holy gost
And bad him torne a ȝeyn in hast:
Go a non . and syng þi mes,
ffor al þi synnes . for ȝiuen is.
þis child spac redeliche . wiþ mouþe,
But bi kuynde . speke hit ne couþe,
But for Miracle spac hit þare
And bad him leue . al his care
þus wiþ mouþe, . as I. haue sayd,
And þus . for þis Bisschop . layd. 358 Sm.: Thar it in noriz arm was laid.
þis Bisschop wondrede . in his þouht,
But certeynliche . wuste he nouht
wheþer þis ȝonge child . spak him tille
wiþ gode gost . oþur wiþ ille;
þerfore wolde he nouht . torne a ȝeyn 363 Ms. vous st. vois, Sm. norz.
Ne to þis childes vois . be bayn,
But dude him forþ . as he weore mad,
ffor riht repentaunce made him drad.
And an Angel . bi wey he mette
In Monnes forme, . and feire him grette
And seide: . god sende me to þe,
þat biddeþ þe bold . and siker be
þat al þi sunne . for ȝiuen is;
And þerfore torn . and sing þi mes.
þe Bisschop ferde . as he were mad.
And þis angel . to chirche him lad,
And dude his vestiment . him on,
And made him synge . his Masse son.
þe Bisschop song . his Masse son.
And siþen was . so holy amon,
þat boþe lewed . and lered sayde
þis Auenture was . biforen him layde
To Make him beo . þe beter man
And stiffore stonden . a ȝein sathan.

DIV2.HEAD: 8) hou a bisschop myskepte seynt Jones child.

LG.L: whon holichirche . bi gon newely,
seint Jon was euere . ful bisy
In Ordeynyng . of prestes . and clerkes,
And in castyng . of Churche werkes;
And Mony Bisschops . ordeynde he,
A boue þe lewed folk . to be.
And as he com . a chirche to se,
A. wondur feir child . sauh he.
But no for þen . þis ilke childe
was so vntoun . and so wylde,
þat al þe skaþe . þat he mihte do
he dude, . whon he gon to þro.
And seint Jon hedde . gret pite
þat such a child schulde . dampned be.
seint Jon bi tauhte . þis ilke childe
To a Bisschop, . to make hym mylde.
he seide: Bisschop, . I. Comaunde þe
þat þis tresour . wel ȝemed be;
kep me þis child, . for I. beo teche
hym to þe . as good Leche;
Lete þou nouht him . miskari,
ffor, ȝif he do, . to þe take I.!
þis Bisschop tok . þe child him to,
And Baptiȝede him, . and made him do
þe þyng þat fel . to cristendom.
But vuele felawes . to him com
And drouh him furst to dronkenes,
And siþen to lust . of his flesch,
Aftur to þefþe . and Robberi,
And made his mayster . ful sori—
ffor þat Bisschop . I. calle his Mayster
To whom seint Jon . tok hym to fayster.
ffor luþur men hedde . such Maistri,
To tyse þis ȝonge mon . to foly,
þat þe Bisschop . miht him not holde,
But let hym gon, . wher þat he wolde.
þeoues weore . of hym ful fayn,
ffor to heore wille . wox he ful bayn;
so styf . and stalworþe mon. wox he,
þat þei let him . heore Mayster be.
Longe he eode . wiþ his felawes
And Robbed trewe men . in wode∣schawes.
And seynt Jon com . a noþur tym
And asked his Mayster aftur him,
And seide: wher is my tresore?
Mak him a non . cum me byfore!
þis Bisschop stood . as he were schent,
ffor he wust not . what seint Jon ment:
he wende he asked . seluer . or . golde,
Or vestimens . of Riche folde.
And þerfore . to seint Jon . seide he:
I. wot neuere what . ȝe aske me.
And seint Jon asked: . wher is he,
þat child, . þat i beo tok . to þe?
whon þis Bisschop þis askyng herde,
he weop wel sore, . and þus onswerde:
Allas . þat euere . I. him sawe!
he is by come . an Outlawe.
seint Jon wep, . and seide him tille:
Allas . whi keptust hym . so ille?
To hym hastou . vuel kepere bene,
þat is nou wel . on hym i sene.
An hors, he seide, . sadele me,
ffor I. wole hym seche . where he be.
And seynt Jon eode . þer he was,
And fond hym sittynde . in a paas.
whon þis felawes . seint Jon sawe,
To him þei gonne . alle drawe.
But heore Mayster . kneuh his face,
And fleyh a non . out of þat place:
so muche schome . of hym he þhouhte,
þat loken on hym . dorst he nouhte,
But fleih from hym . faste rennynge.
And seint Jon suwed him . faste cle∣pynge,
And seide: leue sone, I. preye þe
Torn a ȝeyn . and spek wiþ me!
whi fleostou . þi ffadur, whi?
Al þi synne . on me take I.
Atte laste . þis outlawe stood,
And loked doun . wiþ dreri mod,
And to seint Jon . fel doun to feete
And sore bi fore him . he gon wepe.
And seynt Jon seide: . my lore þou lete,
And good forȝiuenes . I. þe by heete:
þi synnes I. take . alle to me,
And I. schal preye . to god for þe,
And sikerliche here . I. þe bi hihte
Good forȝiuenesse . of al þi plihte.
þis Mon fel . to seint Jones feete
And sore bi gon he . forte wepe,
And seide: . I. graunte . my foly;
Of me, fadur, . þou haue merci!
he folewede seint Jon . to þe churche
And hihte him . al his wille to worche,
And was so good mon . from þat tym,
þat alle men hedde . Joye of hym.
heer may ȝe seo . a tale þat schewes
þat muche skaþe don . vuel felawes,
ffor vuel felawes . ofte drawes
fful goode men to synful plawes.
þerfore is god . we drawe hem tille
þat gladly worcheþ . godus wille.
ffor crist . in vr gospel schawes
Ensaumple to drawe to goode felawes:
ffor vr gospel seiþ . where . and when
Crist was founde . among wyse men,
And not among . vn wyse felawes
To tille Men . to ille plawes.

DIV2.HEAD: 9) þat spiritualte scholde not be sold.

LG.L: þe bok of kynges . telleþ vs
hou þe prophete . helyseus
Of Lepre heled . an heþene Man
þat mihti was . and hiȝte Naaman.
But ȝifte of hym . wolde he non take,
ffor him þhouhte hit were . synne and sake
To sulle þe ȝifte . þat god hym ȝaue.
But he hedde . an vuel knaue
þat wolde gladly . Catel haue,
ffor Couetyse . him to synne draue.
ffor he ran . aftur Naman,
whon he was . fro his Mayster gon,
And seide: . my maister sendeþ me
To take sum cortesye . of þe,
ffor ffrendes beoþ . comen hym to,
And sum good bi houeþ hym . hem to do.
Naaman . ȝaf him Robes two
And feir won . of suluer also.
And in his hous . he hudde ful raþe
þe suluer . and þe Robes baþe.
But his Mayster . þorwh prophecy
wuste al his dede . and his gylery.
And Gyeȝi . as nout ne ware
Com to his Mayster hous . ful ȝare.
And his Mayster . asked him sone 25 Ms. As st. And.
ffrom whenne he com . and what he hedde done.
And he seide: . sire, . nouhwhere.
And his Mayster . onswerde hym þere
And seide: . I. sauh ful wel þi þefþe,
Of Naaman . hastou take ȝifte;
þerfore þou . and þi sones vchon
schul beo vn hole, . as was Naaman.
And riht as helyseus hihte
so fel him . for his owne plihte,
ffor Gyeȝi . and al his ofspryng
weore vn hole . for þis mis takyng.
þorwh þis Resun . is symonye
Clept lepre . in Bok gostlye,
As þis lepre . and oþur mo
Com crist in vre soule . to slo;
Of Adam lepre . Monkynde hedde smite,
Til crist com . and helede hite,
Riht as he heled . Bodily

þis forseid vn hole mon . in hiȝ. Dieses Exemplum, bei Gelegen∣heit der Heilung eines Aussätzigen durch Christus, ist gegen die Symo∣nie gerichtet; die das Exemplum ein∣leitenden Verse lauten:
Envye and wraþþe . and ffelenye
May be clept . Lepre gostlye,
And Couetyse . and symony;
þat was wel seene . on Gyeȝi:
ffor Gyeȝi . and al his kynde,
As we in Bok of kynges fynde,
was vnhol . þorwh symony
þat muche spilleþ . now Clergy:
ffor hit is seene . wherwiþ men Buyes
wiþ worldus catel . prelacyes
And þyng . þat Godus ȝifte schulde be;
ffor worldus weolþe . selle we
Euere whon we don . gostly dede
ffor ȝifte . more þen for Godus mede.
As dude sum tyme . Gyeȝi
þat wox vn hol . þorwh his gileri. )

DIV2.HEAD: 10) hou a knyt dude his pen∣aunce among wormes.

LG.L: AN holy mon . bi ȝonde þe séé
was Bisschop . of a gret Citéé,
Good mon he was; . and pers he hihte.
And þer bi syde . woned a knihte
þat þorwh kynde . was bonde and þral,
But kniht hood gat he . wiþ catel.
þis Catel gat he . wiþ Okeryng
And lad al his lyf in Corsyng,
ffor he haunted . boþe day and niht
his Okeryng, . siþen he was kniht
As faste as he dude . bi fore,
And þer wiþ gat he . gret tresore.
But crist þat bouht us . wiþ his pyn
wolde not . þis monnes soule tyn,
But ȝaf (him) grace . him self to knowe
And his synne . to þe Bisschop schowe.
whon he him schrof . to þe Bisschope,
þis Bisschop bad him . han good hope
And asked him . ȝif he wolde take
Riht penaunce . for his soule sake.
fful gladliche . wol I. take, . he seide,
þe penaunce . þat on me is leyde.
þe Bisschop seide: . þou schalt meete
A. Beggere . soone . in þe strete,
And what so euere . he askeþ þe
ȝiue him, . and þat schal þi pen∣aunce be.
wel a payed . was þis kniht,
ffor him þhouȝte . his penaunce liht.
And as he eode homward, . he gon meete
A. Beggere, . þat feire gon hym grete
And seide: leoue sire, par charite
wiþ sum almus . þou helpe me!
þe kniht asked him . what he wol∣de haue.
Lord, he seide, . sum whete . I. craue.
hou muchel, . he seide, . askest þou me?
A. quarter, lord, . Ich aske þe.
þis kniht . graunted hym his bone
And let mete . his Corn . ful sone.
vuel payed was þo . þe pore mon,
ffor poke . ne . sak . hedde he non
wher Inne he mihte . þis whete do.
And þerfore seide . þe kniht hym to:
þis whete . I. rede þou sulle me,
ffor ful pore . me þynkeþ þe.
þis pore mon seide: . loth is me
To sulle . Godus Charite;
But lene me . sum vessel þer to 47 Ms. velles st. vessel.
wher In . I. may . þyn almus do.
he onswerde . and seide nay,
ffor al þat þis Beggere . preye may,
And seide: . þis corn . þou sulle me,
ffor vessel . wol I. non lene þe,
þe Beggere mihte . no better do,
But solde þis corn . a ȝeyn hym to
And tok þerfore . fyue schilyng,
And went hym forþ . on his Beggyng.
whon þis Corn . to þis kniht was solde,
he dude hit In . a whucche to holde.
And openede his whucche . on þe þridde day
And fond þere . a selcouþ þyng . he say: 60 fond ist zu tilgen.
snakes . Neddres .þer gon he fynde,
And grete Blake todus . goinde,
Askes, . and oþur wormes felle 63 Sm. arskes.
þat I. con not . on Englisch telle.
þei leop vp to ward . his visage
And maad him al most . falle in Rage:
So was he . for þeos wormes ferd.
But not forþi . þe whucche he sperd.
And eode to þe Bisschop . in a Res
And tolde to hym . al þe caas
þe Bisschop sauh . þat God wolde take.
Of þis Monnes sunnes . wrake,
And seide: . ȝif þou wolt folfille
wiþ worþi penaunce . godus wille
And clause wiþ penaunce . riht worþi
Al þyn almus . and þi foly,
I. rede . þat þou þi self . falle
Naked . among þe wormes alle;
ȝiue þou of þi self . no tale,
To bringe þi self . out of Bale;
þeih þe wormes . þi Careyn gnawe,
þi peyne lasteþ . but a þrawe,
þenne schal . þi soule wende
To lyuen in blisse . wiþ outen ende.
þis Okerere . was selly Rad
To do . þat þe Bisschop bad,
But of Merci . he hedde good hope.
And ȝerne he preyed . þe Bisschope
And seide: leue ffadur, . I. preye þe
þat þou preye . Inwardliche for me
þat god ȝiue me his grace to fonge
On my bodi . þis penaunce stronge.
þis Bisschop hihte . þis mon trewely
To preye for him . Inwardly.
þis mon wente hom . swiþe i rad
And dude . as þe Bisschop bad,
ffor among . þe wormes snelle
As naked as he was boren . he felle.
þeos wormes eeten . þis wrecched mon
And lafte no þing . but bare bon.
þe Bisschop wente . in to þe toun,
wiþ Clerkes . in gret processioun,
And com in to þe knihtes wones
And souhte ful ȝeorne . his holy bones,
To þis forseyde whucche . he ȝode,
And openede hit . wiþ Joyful mode,
And groped a mong . þe wormes laþe,
But non of hem mihte . don him skaþe,
And forþ he gon . þe bones drawe,
And þei weore . as whit as snowe
whon alle þe bones . weore out tan,
he let brenne . þe wormes ilkan,
And beere þis bones . ful worschuply
And buriede hem . in an Nonnery.
þere God scheweþ . Miracle and miht,
And ȝiueþ blynde Men . heore siht,
And croked men . he makeþ go,
And leeseþ seke men . of wo,
And scheweþ wel . wiþ feire ferliches
þat þe bones beoþ . goode Relikes.
þis tale haue I. nou told ow here
To make ow seo . on what Manere
þat þe More catel . þat mon haueþ
þe More . and More . his herte craueþ,
And nomeliche . þis Okereres,
þat ben Cursed . for heore aferes:
But ȝif . þei here . heore lyf amende,
þei wenden to wormes . wiþ outen ende
þat schal hem ofte . tere and reende
In helle pyne . wiþ outen ende.
þat wuste þis Bisschop . witerly,
And þerfore he dude . queyntely,
whon he let wormes . ete þe Man,
To kepe his soule . from sathan:
ffor wormes schulde . his soule han rendet,
wher so euere . hit hedde i leendet,
Ȝif he ne hedde . wel beo schriuen
And his Careyn . to wormes ȝiuen.
But for his flesch . was pyned here,
his soule is now . to God ful dere,
þere hit woneþ . wiþ pley and game.
God bryng vs þider . al in same!

DIV2.HEAD: 11) hou macarye say þe deuel beryng hys boystes.

LG.L: (And of þat seed . þat sathan soweþ
A good tale . seint Jerom schoweþ:)
Off an hermyte, . an holy mon,
þat woned in wast . him self al on.
An(d) as he . in his Celle sat,
he sauh þe ffend . go bi þe ȝat,
Boystes fele . on him he bare,
Riht as he . a Leche ware.
þer bi syde . was an Abbey,
And þiderward . he tok þe wey.
þat holy mon, . þat sauh þe fende,
Asked hym . whodur . he wolde wende.
To þat abbey. . he seide, i gange,
ffro þenne I. haue . I. beo to lange.
þis hermyte þhouhte . gret ferly
Of his Boystes, . and asked why
he Ber on him . þe Boystes alle.
wiþ hem, he seide, . hoselen i schalle
Alle þe breþeren . of þat Abbeye,
ffor wiþ hem wol I. fonde to pleye,
And hose O Medicine . wol forsake
Anoþur I. schal . make him take:
Ȝif he wol not . of glotonye,
I. schal hym hosele . wiþ Envye,
Oþur wiþ sum oþur . spicerye
Of pruyde . and . Onde . and ffelenye,
Oþur wiþ sum oþur . louely drynke
þat may make hym . of synne þynke.
þis hermyte . let þat feond go
And ba hym come . a ȝeyn riht so.
þe hermyte preiede god . in þat neode
To lette þe ffend . in þat dede.
þis ffend to þat Abbey ede
And fondede . ȝif he mihte spede.
whon þe ffend hedde don . al þat he mihte,
he com sone a ȝeyn . bi þis hermyte;
wiþ careful chere . sore he sihte,
ffor þat he . spede ne mihte.
þis hermyte asked . him ful sone:
hou hastou sped? . what hastou done?
he seide: I. haue . I. sped ful ille,
ffor non of hem wolde . do my wille,
wolde non of hem . my lore list,
Bote on, þat hihte . Teotist,
ffor I. fynde hym . redi to do
My wille euere . whon I. come hym to.
whon þis was seid, . he wente a wey.
And þe hermyte eode . to þat Abbey.
þe Monkes come . hym alle a ȝeyn.
ffor of his come . þei weore fayn.
he asked aftur . Teotistas,
And þei tauht hym . wher he was,
ffor alle þei woneden . in heore celle,
As hit to hem . heore ordre felle.
wiþ Teotist . þis hermyte mette,
And eiþer . feire oþur grette.
þis hermyte asked . ȝif he weore ouht
ffondet . wiþ fleschelykynge . in þouht.
he onswerde . and seide nay,
ffor him þhouhte . schome to say.
þis hermyte . him onswerde þan
And seide: . ich am a ful old man,
And ȝit not aday . to þe ende
May I. my flesch . from fondyng wende:
hou maiȝt þou . in þi ȝouþe
wiþ flesclich fondyng . beo vnkouþe?
þis Maner spac . þe hermyte him tille
To make him schewe . his þouhtes wille.
And Teotist . asked Merci
And seide: leue fadur, . so am I.,
so harde i fondet . wiþ lecheri
þat my flesch . may . I. not chasti.
þis hermite . tauhte þenne . hou þat he
schulde stif a ȝeyn . sathanas be.
And whon þis Monk . was brouht in state,
þis hermyte wente . hom his gate.
And sone aftur . eft he sawe
þe fend touward . þe Abbey drawe.
And soone aftur . he com aȝeyn.
And þis hermyte . bi gon to frayn
And asked him . hou he hedde isped.
And he onswerde . as he weore mad
And seide: allas . and weylaway,
þat euere I. com . to þat abbay!
ffor bi no maner . may I. wynne
Of þe lordeyns . þat wone þer Inne,
ffor non of hem . lykeþ my play,
But alle þei cacche . me away,
In hem part . may i haue riht non
ffor alle þe craftus . þat I. con;
ffor Teotist, . þat me was left,
Is nou from me . schomely reft:
To me was he wont . to beo bayn,
And nou is he . me stiuest a ȝeyn;
þerfore i seo . þat me ne dare
To þat Abbeye . drawe no mare.
þis hermyte . þonked God almihti
þat made þe ffendes craft . Empti.
þis tale . ful openly schowes
what seed . þe fend of helle sowes.

DIV3.HEAD: a. hou vr lady gaf a good wyf a sherge.

LG.L: A Tale of þis feste Candlemas day. . I. haue herd
hou hit . of a wydewe ferd
þat louede vr ladi . so wel
þat heo let make hire . a Chapel,
And vche day . deuoutely
heo herde Masse . of vre ladi.
ffel auntur . þat hire prest was gon
On his ernde, . and Masse hedde heo non.
And com þis Condulmasse . feste,
And heo wolde han, . as wyf honeste,
hire Masse; . and for heo mihte gete non,
heo was a ful sori . wommon.
In hire Chapel . heo made preyere
And fel aslepe . bi fore þe Autere.
And as heo lay a slepe, . hire þhouhte
þat heo in to a Chirche . was brouhte,
And sayh þer come . a gret Cumpany
Of feire Maydenes, . wiþ a ladi,
And alle þei sete . on Rowe ful raþe,
And olde men . and ȝonge baþe
Com aftur hem . and sete hem by.
And a Clerk brouhte . serges in hiȝ,
And eueri mon . he ȝaf on,
And so he ȝaf . þe slepynde wommon.
And twey Clerkes . heo saih comande
In sorplys, . wiþ serges in hande;
And aftur hem, . Reuested raþe,
Com sodekne . and dekne baþe;
And Crist him self . com þer nest,
Reuested . as a Masse prest.
þei eode to þe Auter . gladly greyde,
And priue preyere . þer þei seide,
And Clerkes bi gonne . sone þe mes,
As Costum . in holichirche is.
whon þei come . to heore offrand,
þis ladi eode, . wiþ serge in hand,
And offred furst, . as Comely Qwene,
And aftur hire . oþure bi deene.
þis wommon sat euer stille, . as hire þouht,
ffor offre hire condel . wolde heo nouht.
þe prest a bod . by fore þe autere,
But heo nolde . come hym neere.
And word to hire . sende vre ladi
And seide þat heo dude . vyleny
To make þe prest . bide hire so longe,
And bad heo schulde . rise and gange
And offre hire serge, . as oþur hedde don.
And heo onswerde . and seide son:
wel mote þe prest . þe Masse forþ synge,
ffor my condel . wol not I. him bringe;
But go and sey . to my ladi:
þat God haþ sent me . holden wol I.
A. ȝeyn eode . þis Messagere
And tolde his ladi . hire onswere.
his ladi bad him . anon go
And take þe serge . wiþ strengþe hire fro,
ȝif heo wolde not . wiþ gode wille hit ȝelde.
But whon he com, . faste heo hit heolde
ffor al þat he mihte . preye and say, 59 Ms. sayh.
stifliche heo heold . hire condul ay.
And he ron to hire . atte laste
And drouh þe serge, . and heo heold faste,
þis Condul brac . bi twene hem two—
And heo a wok . of slepe riht þo
And fond a trounsun . redi Broken
And faste . in boþe hire hondes loken.
heo þhouȝte þer of . ful gret ferly,
And þonked god . and vre lady
þat wolde such pryuite hire schowe,
And let men hit . wiþ tokne knowe:
ffor redi tokne . was þis trounsun
Of þis ferly . a visioun.
þis trounsoun . for relyk heo heold
Al hire lyf . (wiþ) worschipe and beld,
And ȝit doþ, . as we fynde i told,
fful feire Miracles . mony fold.
Beo þis tale, . as þinkeþ me,
May we vr ladies cumfort se
þat wolde proue . þis wyues wille
And hire longyng . wiþ Joye folfille,
And not al one . in heuene riche,
But in eorþe here . wiþ feir ferliche,
ffor feir ferliche . was þis trounsoun
þat heo gat . wiþ deuocioun.

DIV3.HEAD: b. hou on abbesse wyt chylde was delyuered þorou vr lady.

LG.L: (ffor do a Mon neuer so gret synne,
And he haue wille . hit to blynne
And asken hire Merci . riht Inwardly,
he may beo syker . of Merci.)
ÞAt may we seo . by a ladi
þat was . In a Nonneri.
But as heo eode vppon a day
A. boute neodes . of hire Abbay,
In Cloutes . beo þe wey . heo fond
A ȝong Maydechild . weopand.
And hedde pite . of þat fyndyng,
And let hit . in to hire Nonnery bryng,
And let hit beo . ful wel i kept.
And siþen to boke . heo hit set,
And made hit Nonne . in þat Nonneri,
And louede hit . ful Inwardly—
ffor heo louede, . as god wommon,
hire gostly douhtres euerichon.
And so wel ordre . louede ho
þat no mis . mihte hire douhtres do
þat heo ne chastised hem . in hiȝ
And made hem leue . heore foly.
Goode wymmen . louede hire forþi,
Bote fooles . hatede hire dedly.
To hire hedde . þe fend envye
And fondet hire . inwardlye,
ffor niht . and day . he was bysy
To tende lust . in hire body.
And atte laste . in lecheri
he made hire falle . wrecchedly:
ffor hire spenser . kneuh hire fleschly.
And hire wombe . wox gret in hiȝ.
But feire heo bar hire not . forþi,
As wymmen doþ . þat don foly.
heo bi þouhte hire . niht . and . day
To whom heo miht best . hire coun∣seil say.
And hir þhouhte wel . þat best mihte ho
hire derne dede . to hire vndo
whom heo hedde . from fyndyng fed
And feire . in Nonne wede . I. cled,
ffor heo was holden . to hire mast,
To beo to hire trewe . and studefast.
heo clepte þis Nonne . pryuely
And seide to hire: . douhtur, Merci!
I. haue a derne . priuite
To telle . by twene þe . and me;
But ded me were leuere . to be
þen þou of my dede . outed me,
ffor, ȝif þou me . þer of Melde,
I. haue lost . worldus belde.
þis Nonne onswerde . and seide: ladi,
ffor al þis worldus gold nolde I
Do þing þat were . a ȝeyn þe;
þerfore ladi, . tel þou me
wiþ oute doute . þi pryuete,
ffor þenne maiht þou proue . my lewete;
Tel baldeliche . þi wille to me,
ffor siker may þou . of me be!
þis Abbes leued . wel hire sawe,
And al hire synne . heo gon hire schawe,
And seide: leue douhtur, . me is wo,
ffor grete wiþ childe . nou I. go.
þis Nonne onswerde . and seide: ladi,
Beo þou þerfore . no þing sory!
ffor wel i schal . þi Counseil hele
And don wiþ þe . as douhtur lele;
ffor, whon þis child is boren, . þen schal I
Don hit of dawe . so pryuely
þat no wiht schal . þe wepyng here,
And delue hit seþþe . in vre herbere.
þis Abbes leued hire . ful wel
And wende þat heo weore . trewe as stel.
But hos saueþ a þef . from hongynge,
Or bringeþ vp such . a foundelynge,
Of neiþer geteþ he . menske ne mede,
Ne socour, . whon þat he haþ nede.
ffor þat was sene . ful openly
In þis fyndynge, . þat hire ladi
Beo wried . to þe Bisschop sone
And tolde him . what heo hedde i done.
who was wroþ . but þis Bisschope!
ffor of þis abbes . he hed(d)e hope
þat heo hedde ben . a good wymman,
And for þouhte . þat heo hedde mis tan.
hire douhtres . herde . of hire foly,
And summe were glade, . and summe sori.
ffor badde wymmen . weore ful fayn
þat þei hedde chesun . hire a ȝeyn.
And wiþ here lettres . preyed þay
þat þe Bisschop schulde . sende hem day,
To proue her abbesse . synful play,
þat heo mihte not . þer a ȝeyn say.
whon day was set, . þe tyme com neih
þat þis abbes . schulde peynes dreih
And beo dilyuered . of hire childe:
heo made hire mone . to Marie mylde.
þat niht . in hire Chapel . heo wok
þat wyues scholde on þe Morwe hire lok:
ffor þe Bisschop . a ȝeyn þe Morwen
somounde wyues . hym bi foren,
þat þei schulde . him þe soþe say
wher þis Abbes . were a May.
And þerfore was þis abbes . aferd,
whon heo . of þis tiþing herd.
heo weop ful sore . on vre ladi
And asked hire help . and Merci.
whon heo was weori . of hire preyer,
heo fel on slepe . bifore þe Auter.
To hire com sone . vre ladi
And snibbed hire . of hire foly;
On hire wombe . heo leyde hire hond:
And þis abbes . was, al slepand,
Dilyuered . of a knaue childe,
And siþen was . good mon and Milde.
vr ladi tok þis child, . al warm,
And leyde hit . in an Angles Barm,
And bad him bere . þat child . riȝt tyte
vppon hire half . to an hermyte
þat wonede þeoþene Myles seuene.
And þis childes nome . gon heo ne∣mene.
Bid him, heo seide, . þis child Baptise
And bring hit vp, . as good norise.
whon þis was seid, . heo wente a way.
And þe Abbesse a wok . þer heo lay.
On hire bare kneos . heo hire sette,
And sweteliche . vr ladi grette,
And seide: ladi, . I. þonke þe,
fful wel hastou . dilyuered me.
And in þat Chapel . al þat niht
heo þonked vr ladi . til day liht.
þe Bisschop com . wiþ his clergye
A Morwe . to þat . Nonnerye,
To ȝiue riht laweful . Juggement
Of þis abbes . þat was so schent.
But he let wyues . not forþi
Loke allerfurst . hire bodi,
And maad hem swere . þat þei schulde say
ȝif þat heo weore . a clene may.
And whon þei hedde . hire bodi sene,
heo semed a Mayden, . as clene
As heo neuer hedde . i touched bene.
And þeose wyues come . alle bydene
And sworen þat heo was . Mayden clene.
And þe Bisschop . was þenne ful kene
On þat Nonne . þat tolde hym þe tale,
And bad heo schulde . be brend in Bale
As wikked wommon . þat wikkedly
hedde i lyȝed , on hire Lady.
þis Abbesse hedde . on hire pite
þat heo for hire . scholde i damp∣ned be,
And tolde þe Bisschop . pryuely
þe soþe . and hou vr lady
Diliuerede hire . and made hire al quite
And sende hire sone . to þat hermyte,
To Norische . and to sette to lore.
And þe Bisschop . wiþ swetly swore
A soylede hire . and þonked Mari
þat is to synful . euere redi.
þe Bisschop . to (þe) hermyte . sende his sonde
þat þere hire child . In Cradul fonde.
And whon hit was . of seuen ȝere,
þe Bisschop made hit . a good scolere.
And whon þis ilke Bisschop . was ded,
þis Clerþ was Bisschop . in his stedd'.
Beo þis tale . may ȝe rediliche se
þat no synful . þar schamed be,
haue þei do neuere . such foly,
ȝif þei calle . on vre ladi.
þerfore, ȝif ȝe in synne falle,
I. rede þat we . on Marie calle
þat heo purchace vs . grace to rise,
And siþþe dwelle . in hire seruyse
Euermore . to vr lyues ende:
And siker may we beo . to wende
In to þat court . þer heo is Qwene.
þider heo bringe vs . alle bi dene!

DIV2.HEAD: 13) De quodam heremita vo∣cato non electo.

LG.L: WE fynden I. writen . of an hermyte
þat lyuede longe . wt outen wyte,
ffor he woned . in wildernesse
And serued God . In rihtwysnesse.
But sathanas . þorwh Onde . and nyþe
Com aȝeyn hym, . his Maystrie to kiþe.
To him he com . in knaue liknes,
And dude greten hym . In wildernes,
And seide: . þi Modur . and þi frende
haþ maad me hider . forte wende,
And grette þe wel . and preyede þe
þat þou come to hem . wiþ me,
fforte despende . þi fadur þyng
þat he lafte . aftur his endyng;
ffor, while he lyuede, . faste preyed he
þat þou his sekatur . mihte be.
þat day, he seide, . þi fadur dyed—
But falsliche . as a þeef . he lyȝed.
þeos wordus seide . þe fend of helle,
To bringe þis hermyte . out of his Celle.
þis hermyte wende . þat al soþ were
þat þis Messager . tolde hym þere.
hamward wiþ hym . gon he wende—
ffor wuste he not . hit was þe fende.
whon he com hom, . his ffadur he fond
In good stat . and styf hosebond.
But sone . whon he his Modur sawe,
Out of his siht . went his felawe.
And his ffadur . ful feire hym cald.
And al to gedere . his fadur he tald
how sathanas . made him comen hom—
ffor of his hom come . him þouhte schom.
But worldes wele . sone hym gert
puyte serwe and schome . out of his hert:
ffor so longe . in his fadur house
was he, . þat he þouhte to spouse.
he tok hym wyf, . as fool vnwys,
And dyȝed . in sathanas seruys.
Beo þis tale . þat I. haue her told
May we seo: þauh we be cald
To Religiun, . not forþi
May we no(t) wite . sikerly
wheþer we beo chosun . in blisse to beo—
As we may . bi þis hermyte seo:
ffor he was cald, . and not chosun,
ffor his dedes . made him beo loren.

DIV2.HEAD: 14) hou seynt Maryne was diffamed. Eine andere Version der Marina enthält Ms. Harl. 2253 fol. 64; ähn∣lich im Stoffe ist Theodora im Ms. Vernon fol. 92.

LG.L: A Riche mon . by olde dawes
þouhte to leue . þis worldus plawes,
And turnede hym . to Religioun,
And þer to . made he . hym boun.
A douhtur he hedde. . þat he bi tauhte
To his frendes . wiþ al his auhte,
And bad þei schulde take . to hire entente.
And so . to an Abbeye . he wente
And Monk he was . I. schore þare.
And so boxum lyf . ladde he þare
þat his Abbot . louede hym mare
þen eny Monk . þat wonede þare.
he lyuede longe . in þat Abbay
And seruede God . boþe niht and day.
But him dradde . þat god schulde tyne
his douhtur, . þat was clept . Maryne;
ffor hire . was his herte sare,
ffor in Ordre . he wolde heo ware.
his Abbot sauh him beo sori
And asked hym . wherfore . and whi
he made such chere . . and he hym tald
þat he hedde a sone, . þat was cald
Maryn. . and fayn, he seyde, . I. wolde
þat he weore brouht . to Godus folde.
his Abbot wolde . þis child fayn haue,
ffor he wende . hit weore a knaue,
And bad him go . aftur hym swiþe.
But her may ȝe . gret' ferly liþe!
þis Monk . aftur his douhtur ede,
And cloþed hir wel . in Monnes wede,
And tauhte hire . hou heo schulde lyue
And al hire herte . to Ihc̄ ȝiue,
And bad þat heo schulde . neuer mare
Lete mon wite . þat heo wommon ware.
whon he hedde tauht hire . hire lessoun,
he brouht hire . in to Religioun.
And ffrere Maryn . heo was cald,
And for a good Monk . heo was told,
ffor heo was good . and seruisable
And in Religiun . ful stable.
hire wommonhed . so wel heo hud,
þat to no mon . hit was kud.
heo woned . in hire ffadur Celle,
And he tauht hire . þat to hire felle:
hou heo schulde . boþe Niht . and day
hire seruise . and hire sauter say.
And whon deþ hedde . hire fadur tan,
heo wonede . in hire celle al an,
In hard penaunce . and goode preyere:
þat maade hire . to crist . leef and dere.
ffel auntur . þat hire breþur ede
In labour, . to don heore dede:
heore labour was . ston beryng
Toward þe werk . of heore buyldyng.
And for Maryn was . wys and war,
heo was set . to lede a Car.
ffer fro þe Abbey . was a quarere,
And þer was wonynge . a Breustere.
þer lay Maryne . ofte a niht,
whon heo mihte not come . hom bi liht.
ffel auntur . þat a ȝong sweyn
hedde þis Breusteres douhter bi leyn.
And whon þe child . in wombe was seene,
hire frendes weore . at hire ful kene
And asked ho hadde . hire bi leyn.
And heo tolde hem . þat frere Maryn
hedde forced hire. . and þei weore wraþe
And tolde his Abbot . ful raþe
þat Maryn hedde . þat may for leyȝen.
And his Abbot . seide þer a ȝeyn,
ffor he wende not . hit soþ mihte be:
so wel frere Maryn . leeued he.
he clepte to hym . Maryn soone
And asked ȝif he . þe synne hedde done.
And mayde Maryne . hire bi þouhte
hou gultiles crist on Rode . hire bouhte:
þerfore on hire . wolde heo take
þis foreseid synne . for cristes sake,
And seide: leue ffadur, . preye for me
þat my synne . for ȝiue be!
I. may not seyn . a ȝeyn þis chaunce
þat I. nam worþi . gret penaunce.
whon þis abbot . herde þis,
he was ful wroþ . wiþ hire i wis,
And seide: Maryn, . allas allas,
þat þou in þis hous . I. ȝolden was!
þi ffadur was . an holy Man,
And þorwh him þou were . hider tan;
Allas þat euere . þou come her Inne!
ffor þou hast schent . þis hous wiþ synne.
And for þou hast . þis Abbey schent,
I. do þe here . out of Couent;
ffor þou hast . so wraþþed Ihc̄,
þou mayht no more . wone wiþ vs.
þo was Maryn . I. do to þe ȝate.
And sore bi gon heo . forte grate
And hard penaunce . he(o) tok hir on, 97 Ms. he.
Riht as heo hedde . þe dede i don.
On werke dayes, . whon þe Couent
fforþ atte ȝate . to labour went,
þei sayh Maryn . sitte so schent.
And summe of hem . ful sore hir ment
And bred or while . to hire brouhte þay:
And þer wiþ lyuede heo . mony a day.
þis Breusters douhtur, . of whom . I. ment,
þat hedde Maryn . þus I. schent,
hedde a knaue child . at hire tym.
And some, whon heo hedde . I. wened hym,
heo bi tauhte hit . to ffrere Maryn,
And seide: lo.Mon, . þis child is þyn;
I. haue wel fed hit . ȝit hider to,
ffeed now hit forþ, . ȝif þou wolt do!
wiþ Maryn . hire sone . lafte ho.
And Maryn tok . þis child hire to
And ȝaf hit . gladliche . to ete
Of such almus . as heo mihte gete.
And two wynter . heo fedde hit þare,
Riht as hit . hire owne ware. 118 Ms. hit ware (hit also doppelt).
whon Maryn hedde . I. lad hire lyue
In þis penaunce . ȝeres fyue,
þe Couent hedde . of hire pyte
And preyede . þe Abbot þat he
schulde lete Maryn . come hem among,
And seiden: his penaunce . was to strong,
ffor atte ȝate . is he to longe,
And vs þinkeþ . þat is wronge:
Bi fore vs alle . his sunne he tolde,
And haþ leyen . atte ȝate ful colde;
And þenne . wol he neuer go,
But dwelle stille . in alle wo.
we preye þat he . mote come In,
ffor god haþ for ȝiuen hym . his syn.
But vnneþe . wiþ gret barete
Mihte þei leue . at þe Abbot gete
þat Maryn mihte come . fro þe ȝate.
But atte laste . he gat in late,
ffor þei preyed . for him so faste
þat he was i fet . atte laste.
whon heo byfore . þe abbot com,
þe Abbot schewed hire . his doom.
he seide: to penaunce . ȝiue I. þe
þat to vs alle . þou driuel be:
þe Couent schon . schaltou smere
And watur . to vre foreyn bere,
ffor þou hast . a Mayde forleyn,
þou schalt clansen . vre foreyn,
And vre Cuchene . schaltou make clene
And wassche vr vessel . al by dene;
And, aftur i seo . þi Mekenesse,
þi trauayle schal I. make lesse.
Maryn . in to þe kechene went
And dude . al his Comaundement,
wiþ oute grucchynge . wel dude ho
Al þat þe abbot . bad hire do.
But sone aftur . dude god his wille
Of hire . and tok hire hym tille.
And þe Abbot, . whon heo was ded,
Tok sone . wiþ his couent red.
Out of þe Chirche ȝerd . he dude hire delue
Al one in felde . by hire selue,
And seide . two Monkes: . goþ in hyȝe
And wasscheþ . ffrere Maryn bodye,
And aftur . delf hit in þe felde,
þat sathanas . þe soule ne welde;
þe more schome . þat þe bodi dryes,
þe fastore þe soule . from pyne flyes.
To flermerye . þis Monkes went,
To do þe Abbotes . Comaundement.
But whon þei sauh . he was wommon.
þei fellen criȝynge . to þe Erþe vchon,
And seiden: . ladi, . Allas Allas,
A ȝeyn þe we han . mis taken vs,
In word . and dedes . mony on!
þerfore to þe . we make . vre Moon.
preye for vs . þat god vs amende!
ffor we seon oþur . þen we wende:
we wende þat þou . a Mon hedde ben,
But, ladi, . now is oþur sen;
þerfore, ladi, . sore we vs mene
þat euer we dude þe wo . or tene;
ffor openliche . we may heere se
þat Godus werkes . are priue,
ffor he wol make . no dune ne ȝelpe
þer he wiþ his grace . wol helpe.
þeos Monkes . to heor abbot ron
And seide frere Maryn . was wommon.
ffeorly hym þhouȝte . of þis tiþing
And to þe Cors . he com rennyng.
And sone . whon he þe soþe seih,
he fel and seide, . criȝinge ful heih:
Ladi Maryne, . for Godus sake
Let God no wreche . on me take,
ffor vnwitynge . I. dude þe mis,
As mon þat ofte . deseyued is.
þerfore I. preye þe . forȝiue hit me,
þe muchel schome . þat I. dude þe.
whon he hedde seid þis . and more,
wiþ herte . and wiþ wepyng sore,
he let keuere . þe cors riht þare
wiþ pal . and wiþ riche fare
And siþen beren hit . derworþ(l)ye
wiþ Joyful song . in Chirche to lye.
þer was þis corseynt . leid in toumbe,
And ȝiueþ nou hele . to def and doumbe,
And oþure seke men . ful fele
han ȝit . at hire toumbe . heore hele.
þis Breusteres douhtur . wox wood,
And com criȝinde . wiþ grisly mood
And tolde þe folk . as wodewose wilde
who gat on hire . þis forseyde childe.
hire frendes say . þat for hire synne
þe fend was comen . hire wiþ Inne.
And harde wiþ Ropes . þei hire band
And ladde hire siþen . sore wepand
To Marynes toumbe, . and woken hire þare.
And God sende hire . good hele fulȝare.
þis longe tale . I haue ou told
To Make ow . in oure hertes bold,
ffor þat mon . ful blessed is
þat con lyuen . in Mekenis
And grucche not . a ȝeyn mis sawe.
ffor, þei me do hym wrong . a þrowe,
he may beo siker . of goode Mede,
ȝif he suffre mekeliche . his misdede.
ffor euer þe more . wrongwysnes
þat gode men þolen here . gultiles,
þe more schal heore mede beo
Bi fore crist . þat is so freo.

DIV2.HEAD: 15) Pater noster for seynt bernardes palfray.

LG.L: WE fynde I. write . þat seynt Bernard
Eode enes . to a Cite ward
Aboute his owne . Abbey nedes,
And sauh a plouh mon . don his dedes.
seynt Bernard . bad hym god spede
And spac to hym . of soule nede.
And as he spac . on þis Manere,
he asked what . was his preyere.
he seide: . preyere con I. non
But my pater noster . al on.
seint Bernard . onswerde þon
Anon . to þis plouh Mon:
what þenkestou, good mon, . al weis,
whon þou þi pater noster . seis?
þen, seide he, . is al my þouht
On crist . þat me on Rode bouht.
seynt Bernard þenne . seide him to:
wel is þe . þat so may do!
ffor so fareþ hit . not wiþ me
þat Mon of Ordre . schulde be:
ffor my þouht goþ . boþe fer and neer
Or while . whon I. seye . my preyeer.
þis plouh mon seide: . þat were ferly
þat þou schuldest . ben worse þen I:
þou hast good pees . in þyn Abbay,
þou ouhtest vuele . lete þi þouhtes (s)tray.
seint Bernard . onswerde hym þan
And seide: . þou art an holy man;
But fond now . ȝif þou may
wiþ outen Idel þouht . þi paternoster say
Of al þis ilke . longe day,
And I. wol ȝiue þe . my palfray.
ho was fayn . but þis plouh mon!
And pater noster . he by gon.
But, ar he mihte . þreo wordus say,
was al his þouht . on his palfray:
Lord, he þouhte, . wher I. schal haue
Boþe sadel . and Bridel . and þe knaue?
þis pater noster . was I. seid sone.
But he sauh wel, . whon he hedde i done,
þat he þouhte . idel þouht þer In.
And, as he wolde hit eft by gyn,
þis hors was in his þouht . al weys.
And so lost he . hors and herneis:
ffor seynt Bernard . wuste what he þouht;
þerfore of hym . ȝaf he riht nouht.
þus fareþ hit ȝit . of folk ful fele
þat þenkeþ more . on heore catele
In preyere . þen of soule hele,
And so . heore owne selue . þei tele.
ffor God wol not . heore preyere here
þat preyeþ hym . on such manere.

DIV2.HEAD: 15) þe story off placidas.

LG.L: AN heþene kniht . hihte placidas,
But heþene Mon . longe he was,
ffor coude he nout . of Cristendome,
And ȝit þat tyme . he woned in Rome.
But þo . ȝif þer eny weore, . wist,
þat leeued . and loued . Ihū Crist,
schulde hard passiun . and pyne drie
And on schomely deþ dye;
þerfore . was cristendom þo hyd,
ffor no cristene mon . dorste beo kyd.
þerfore placidas . was not to wyte
Of Cristendom . ne here of hite.
But noble kynde . of gentyl bloode
Drouh hym a non . to Maners goode,
ffor reuþe of herte . and Charite
Euere . to þe pore . schewed he,
ffor he helped . wiþ almus dede
Alle þat of hym hedde nede;
And ofte he bouhte . of prisoun
Caytyf men . wiþ gret Raunsoun;
And oþur goode dedes . dude he fele—
But longe hit were . alle to mele:
ffor Crist . to Cristendom hym cald
ffor his goode dedes . mony fold—
As I. schal forþurmore . ȝou telle,
whon I. come þerto . in my spelle.
But furst bi houeþ me . to sey ow
On what manere . and how
sire placidas . for his goodnes,
And for his miht . and his prouwes
hedde in Rome . ful gret pouste.
ffor artilous . and wys was he,
he was stif . to stonde in stour,
And war . aȝein mis Auentour:
þerfore . Traian, . þe Emperour,
heold hym . in hold, . in gret honour:
he was Mayster . in alle fihtes
Ouer alle . þe Emperoures knihtes.
In alle his neodes . was he wys
And trewe . in his lordes seruys.
Of gentel kynde . he hedde a wyf,
An hende ladi . and good of lyf:
ffor hende heo was . of al hire dede,
And helped alle . þat hedde nede:
ffor no pore . com to hire hous 45 Ms. þat com.
þat heo ne ȝaf . sum almous;
In word . and . werk . was heo stable
And to hire lord . seruisable.
A good gederyng . was of hem two,
ffor such folk . beo nou ful fo.
þei hedde twey knaue children . in same,
And of hem hedde þei Joye and game,
ffor þei suwed . wiþ miht of Moode 53 of st. and.
Boþe ffadur . and Modur . in maners goode.
sire placidas . ouer alle þyng
Louede venerye, . þat is hontyng.
And as he eode . vppon a day
wiþ his honters . for to play,
A. feir herde of deor . he sawe.
And toward heom . gon he drawe.
But in þe herde . an hert he seih
þat was so gret, . hoge . and heih
þat such an hert hedde he neuer sene.
And hym to take . he was ful kene.
þis hert . he chased . vp .and . doun,
In wode . and . pleyn, . dale . and doun,
so faste . þat he wente in hast
ffrom alle men . in to a wast.
In þis wast . was a gret Clyf,
þat was ful heih, . brod . and stif:
In to þis clif . þis hert vp lep
And stod on ston, . þat stag vp step.
And placidas . suwed hym so neih 73 Ms. placidaci.
And sauh þis grete hert . I. lope so heih
þat of his lupe . ferly hym þouht,
And to hym reche . mihte he nouht.
And as he stod . on hym starande,
he sauh . bi twene his hornes . stande
A Crois, . and crist þer on . hangande.
And in swou (!) . he fel nerhande,
ffor he mihte not wel . sitte vpriht:
so a frayed he was . of þat siht,
But faste he leop doun . of his stede,
And þouhte luytel . of his knihthede.
And vp he sturte . from eorþe in heih,
And þouhte of hym self . gret ferly,
And seide: . of whom . a gast am I.
þat schulde beo kniht. bold . and hardi?
And faste hym self . gon he blame,
ffor him þouhte . of hym self . gret schame.
he steih on stede and houede stille
To loke on þat ferly . his fille.
And sone he sauh . more sel ouþ,
ffor þe hert spak to hym . wiþ mouþ
And seide : . whi hast þou chased me?
I am come . to take þe:
To me . leof and dere þou is
ffor þyn almus . and þi godnis;
I. am þi lord . and þy kyng,
Bute þou hast of me . no knowyng.
ÞEn þhouȝte þis kniht . wel more ferly,
And onswerde . ful Myldely
And seide: . what þow art . þou me schowe,
þat I. may þe . for lord knowe,
And aftur . tel me þy wille,
And gostlich wol I. hit folfille;
Tel me þerfore what þu ert.
And God spak to hym . in þat hert
And tolde hym . hou he made of nouht
þis world, . and hou he adam wrouht,
And hou he . Mon on Rode bouht
Anf from helle . wiþ his deþ hym brouht,
And muchel þyng . he tolde hym þere
þat nou . longe (to) tele were.
fful muchel I. gladet . was placidas,
whon crist hedde i seid hym . what he was;
he fel on kneo . deuouteliche
And þonked crist . inwardliche
þat cristene feiþ . hedde hym told
And from mis bileeue . hedde hym cald,
And seide: lord, . þou me say
hou I. schal serue . þe to pay!
Crist onswerde . and seide hym þan
how he schulde bi come . cristene man,
"And aftur . come to me . here,
Mo of my priuetes . to lere!"
Whon þis was seid, . hom he ede,
þenkyng on crist . and on his rede.
he fond al his men . in o place,
But hedde he no talent . to chase
whon he com hom, . his wyf he told
how crist . to his knowynge . him cald.
heo worschiped God, . as good ladi,
And þonked hym . Inwardly
þat such miracle . wolde hym schowe
And from misbyleeue . so feire hem drawe.
And seide: . vre false Maumetes beoþ nouht
þat ben of ston . and Metal wrouht,
And we han ben . to longe vn wyse
And lad vre lyf . in heore seruyse:
þerfore . wol we now . hem forsake
And vs . to cristes seruise . take.
A boute Midniht . ros heo and he
And lafte slepynge . al heore Meyne,
And tok wiþ hem . heore childre two.
And to a Bisschop . gunne þei go
þat wonede . priuely in Roome
And was hed . of cristendome.
And þis Bisschop . ful feire hem cald.
And placidas . his wille hym told
And to þe Bisschop . gon he schawe
þe feire Miracle . þat he sawe.
þe Bisschop þonked . Ihū crist,
And in his nome . hem Baptist,
And ȝaf newe nome . to placidas
And cald hym . atte fantston Eustas,
And his wyf he called . Theophiste,
And his eldore sone . Teopiste,
And his ȝongere sone . he cald
Agapite, . we fynde i told,—
And cumforted hem . of godus grace.
And hom þei wente . to heore place.
Erly a Morwe . Ros sire Eustas
And eode to wode, . as he wolde chas.
And wente from his men . In hast
And com in to . þat ilke wast
þer he þis fore seid ferly . sawe.
And to þe Roche . gon he drawe:
And sauh þulke Miracle . þare
þat he bi fore . sauh ȝare.
he lihted of his hors . in heiȝe
And þonked crist . derworþlye
And seide: lord, . I. þonke þe
þat þou hast mad . þi kniht . of me!
And comen ich am . eft þe tille,
To wite more . of þi wille.
Crist onswerde . and seide þan
To seint Eustas, . þis holy man:
þow hast wel I. sped, . Eustas!
ffor þou hast geten . nou my graas
And þou hast cast . sathanas
And fald hym . as traitour in plas—
And wiþ þe . is he wroþ . forþi.
But of o þyng . þe warne I:
þat he wol fonde . ful bisily
T(o) Cuiþe to þe . his feleny:
he wol þe fonde . on mony wyse,
ffor þou leuest . his seruyse—
þeih he do so, . nis no ferly:
ffor me he fondet . bysily.
þerfore . bi foren . warny þe,
To make þe stif . a ȝeyn hym be
And ouer come . his wikkednes
wiþ pacience . and Mekenes;
Let Mekenes . beo þi scheld . and spere,
ffor þer wiþ maiȝt þou . best þe were:
